metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13139 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A stack-based buffer overflow in psf_memset in common.c in libsndfile 1.0.28 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted audio file. The vulnerability can be triggered by the executable sndfile-deinterleave.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13139` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsndfile1 - 1.0.28-4ubuntu0.18.04.1
sndfile-programs - 1.0.28-4ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsndfile package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.28-4ubuntu0.18.04.1').
